sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The order of orthographie: or, Sixty sixe rules shortly directing to the true writing, speaking, and pronouncing the English tongue. Necessary for all sorts, for want wherof strangers blame our English tongue of difficultie: many of our owne nation speake it corruptly, many write it falsely, and many are discouraged from learning to write it; and others that can write are ashamed to write to their best friends.. Prat, Jos. (Joseph).
[16] p.
Imprinted by Augustine Mathews for William Lee, and are to be sold at his shop in Fleete street, at the signe of the Golden Buck, neare Seriants [sic] Inne, London, : 1622..
Preface signed "Ios. Prat." Signatures: A-B⁴. Headpieces, initials. Reproduction of original in: Massachusetts Historical Society.
=======

Prat, Jos. (Joseph).
[16] p.
Imprinted by Augustine Mathews for William Lee, and are to be sold at his shop in Fleete street, at the signe of the Golden Buck, neare Seriants [sic] Inne, London, : 1622..
